titlestmt.titleproper: Gabriel Fauré: Letters to Paul Dukas

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 00:00

did.unittitle: Gabriel Fauré: Letters to Paul Dukas
did.abstract: Letters and postcards from the French composer Gabriel Fauré (1845-1924) to the French composer Paul Dukas (1865-1935), as well as poems in Fauré's hand and other items

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to researchers by appointment. There are no restricted materials in the collection. Please contact the Special Collections staff to schedule an appointment.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased at auction by the Music Library of Yale University in June 1977.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The collection is the physical property of the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University. Copyrights belong to the composers and authors, or their legal heirs and assigns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Misc. Ms. 287, Gabriel Fauré: Letters to Paul Dukas in the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: In 4 series as follows: I. Letters with dates. II. Letters without dates. III. Poems. IV. Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gabriel Fauré's letters to Paul Dukas include 60 autograph letters and postcards. This manuscript group also holds 2 poems in Fauré's hand, a postcard with a portrait of Fauré, and a silver pocket metronome.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gabriel Fauré (1845-1924) and Paul Dukas (1865-1935) were two of the leading French composers of their era. Both men were associated with the Paris Conservatoire; Dukas was a student and later a professor, while Fauré (who had been educated at the Ecole Niedermeyer) served as professor and then director. Dukas, who left a relatively small body of compositions, is best remembered for The Sorcerer's Apprentice. Fauré is known for his songs, piano works, chamber music, and Requiem.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Autograph letter signed, envelope, Postcard, poem

odd.head: General
odd.p: Opening line: Une porte est elle...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Catalog of sale held June 20, 1977, at Drouot Rive Gauche, Paris.
Fauré letters to Dukas are listed as no. 110.
